It's an LG.Why are people buying 3D TV's? Visuals on this LG seem to come out the screen! The bonus no need for glasses which eventually HURT my eyes.I plug my laptop into 1 of many HDMI ports, and It's a Smart tv, Cable, Games, etc.I truly doubt I'll ever go to the theater, pay for cable, or buy another TV again. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: Bang for the Buck Winner!
Reviews.Author: Spiderick
Reviews.Content: This set was not my first choice. The one I wanted was not available at the time. I had it sent to me on a one day delivery with my Amazon Prime membership. It arrived in perfect shape and was put together in about 20 min. This set just impresses me every single time I turn it on. No dead pixels, and no backlight bleed. It does take some fine tuning to achieve a great picture, but all the tools are there. All in all, I highly recommend this set and I also think it is a steal at this price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the $
Reviews.Author: Aemal Khattak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv after a lot of research - See if you can get the Amazon pricing (got it for under $1,000 + free shipping via Prime; right now listed for $1,299), that is sweet.Pros: Nice picture, easy controls, sleek design, no 3-D (yes, I consider that a plus).Cons: Sound quality of the built-in speakers, only a TOSLINK (optical cable) port for connecting to the receiver, and the stand is flimsy. It must be secured at the back end to prevent TV from tipping over. LG provides a location in the stand base where the stand can be screwed to the table top, provided you want to drill a hole in your table top. I mounted it on a wall so tipping over is not an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV from a Reliable Manufacturer at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: Recently, I've noticed a lot of people going crazy of panasonic deals for a similar tv and it seems that this LG unit is fairly overlooked. For the price, this tv is phenomenal.The Good:-The picture quality is stellar. Blacks are good and the color toning is on spot.-The speakers are amazing. Normally units such as these are expected to have terrible speakers but this one is clean, clear, sharp and deep. No hollow old school radio sounding speakers here.- The price. Amazon has this tv listed for significantly cheaper than most of b&m; stores.The Bad:This might just be me, but I love that motion interpolation feature on these newer sets. That said, While I enjoy it many may not and as far as I can tell there is no way to turn it off on this unit. (I may be wrong on this).

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV and Delivery
Reviews.Author: Bigger Jake
Reviews.Content: My LG 55LS4600 arrived yesterday. The HDTV was purchased through Amazon and delivered/setup by CEVA.When I ordered the HDTV, I selected a date and time window for delivery. The day before the delivery date, I received and e-mail from CEVA with a specific time for delivery. On delivery date, they called up and said they would be two hours late (after the time indicated in the e-mail).When they arrived, they deboxed, assembled the stand on the HDTV, and placed the TV on my TV stand. I kept the boxes to facilitate return (if necessary) during the 30 day return period.My experience with CEVA was excellent. The delivery was in Southern California.The LG's picture is great (as expected). The sound is a little weak but this is to be expected on a "thin" LED/LCD TV and I have an audio system in place to handle the TV. As others have stated, I would buy a sound bar for a thin LED/LCD TV in any case. After spending a lot on an HDTV, why short change yourself on sound by not spending a little more on a sound system?This HDTV does not have 3D or internet apps. I do not want 3D at this point in the deployment cycle. Maybe the technology will be more standardized and developed when I replace this TV.There is an Ethernet connection for connecting to your home network. This connection is used to get firmware updates and access content (movies, photos, etc.) from other devices (usually PCs) on your home network (DLNA). I briefly tested that his connectivity worked (looked for a firmware update and played a movie). The DLNA connectivity is not important to me.I specifically did not want a Smart TV (with internet apps like Netflix, Amazon Video, etc.)included on the TV. I think the better idea is to have a separate purchased small box to connect between the internet and the TV (I use a Roku box but there are several available) with these apps. I hope to keep the TV for at least six years but expect to replace the box with newer models with more features every two or three years. I don't want to have to upgrade the TV to replace the box. Also, my previous experience has been the apps work better on a separate box than on  a TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First, I was confused but be aware this is NOT a smart TV (that means no Hulu, Netflix, built in, you'll need something like a roku box for that)That being said I specifically didn't want a smart TV because I wanted the money I was paying to go into the TV and not into making deals for apps on my tv.This is my first HDTV so I'm certainly not an expert but the picture quality is beautiful.  I spent a lot of time researching to make sure we got the right one and after about a month of research we settled on this one.  Purchase was made from SAM'S CLUB because at the time they were $30 cheaper, and to be honest I was nervous about shipping something as fragile as this.Sound quality is OK, but I'm known for having a tin ear as well.  I did have to enable the smart volume because otherwise it fluctuated so badly.

Reviews.Title: Overall Excellent TV with some small issues 4.5 overall
Reviews.Author: Yojimbo
Reviews.Content: So far so good, I've owned the 47 inch for about 2 weeks and I've been impressed with the picture quality. I knew going in that I wanted a model without 3d or the smart tv options. The major brands all had a model around the same size with similar specs, amazons sale decided me on picking the 4600 up when it went below 700 dollars. Currently I have a cable box, xbox 360 and playstation 3 hooked with 3 hdmi cords so I can't speak to the other hookups.Its necessary to tweak the video setting to get the full potential out of the picture. Out of the box the cinema setting is too dark and the sports is too bright, the game option works pretty well but needs some fine tuning. The built in picture wizard is a good tool to calibrate the basic settings of the tv but it caused me to overdo the backlight setting. One issue with the tv, which I've found after researching lcd-led edge lit tv's is that its hard to avoid having a tightrope with edge bleed. If you want the bright scenes to display well and you crank the backlight up the dark scenes will have some edge bleed and vice versa if you crank the back light down the light scenes lose contrast but you'll have less edge bleed. The edge bleed is pretty subtle and is mostly in the lower right corner of the screen, I didn't even notice it until after having the tv for a couple of days.The best compromise I've found that pretty much gets rid of the edge bleeding is setting the brightness which controls your whites to around 95-100, contrast which controls black levels to around 40-45 and setting backlight to depend on the lightness of your room, lower for dark rooms and higher for brighter ones. Usually around 40 or lower for darker rooms and up to around 60 for brighter.  I really noticed the edge bleed after using the picture wizard and setting the backlight to 100. There are two built in professional calibration options that allow for further customization of color, which I haven't messed with very much.There has been a lot of comments about the speakers being bad and I'm not much of an audiophile but I haven't had an issue with them. They aren't home theater quality and I'm not coming from a surround sound theatre, the tv is in my bedroom so the sound isn't having to fill a large room but they've been sufficient so far. If your coming from a fancier audio setup up you'll probably want to upgrade the speakers. Turning on the surround setting does do a good job of giving the sound more depth.I was impressed with amazon's delivery time, I'm a prime subscriber and was happy that the tv had free 2 day shipping. I was a little nervous when I saw it was being delivered by UPS but the driver did an excellent job of being careful with the tv and there was no issue with the physical condition when I unboxed and installed it. Overall I would give the tv a 4.5 rating but will round it up to 5.Update for 4/11/13I've owned the tv for around 6 months now and am still happy with the product. I did end up buying a soundbar which did improve the sound quality a lot. I would also recommend using the video setting CNET used for their review. You can find them by googling cnet lg 4600 settings. While I'm pleased with the tv overall I have become disappointed with the brightness of whites, which are okay but could use a little more pop.

Reviews.Title: Very good set, but no the best fit for everyone.
Reviews.Author: Matt "disappearingone"
Reviews.Content: I had been using an old Sony WEGA 1080i CRT set for the past 10 years or so, not even sure if large LCD panels were even in the Big Box Stores yet, if they were they were very expensive, CRT and projection was still the norm for common folk. A week ago today I had a sudden impluse urge to buy a new set and very quickly came to the LG 47LS4600 based on price and useful features. I've assisted other friends and family ( I'm the tech geek) over the years on purchases so I had a good baseline for what I wanted...and that was the best picture at the best price, with bonus of light weight ( bulk and weight was a prime reason I stuck with the sony CRT so long...living in an upsatirs apartment with no elevator make it loads of fun to move)......so 120HZ LED big screen for under $700 including saturday delivery....I pounced...  All in all I got a very good set, though wish I did a bit more research as I would have gone plasma. The viewing area I use is very dimly lit if lit at all so its been a bit of struggle to get black levels where I would like them....I've tweaked like crazy and can get great black levels if I dial the backlight way down to 10-20....however then my whites become grey...in short this set is best used in well lit rooms, which isnt me...That said overall its something I can live with, might make upgrading happen sooner, though hopefully I'll keep it till OLED sets reach mass market.  Gripes other than that of poor research are , with my set at least its very red on standard color temp, I have to use cool setting, warm is extremely red. The color red itself was also a problem using the built in calibration tools, the color itself I could not make vivid without screwing up the rest of the picture. The Disney WOW calibration disc helped very much with that though with the most advanced calibration tool set.  All in all its a great set at a great price, just be aware of room light, this set rocks for higher light areas, for dim to dark go plasma or go much further up the price range.

Reviews.Title: Superb HDTV
Reviews.Author: Scott E. Fisher
Reviews.Content: I bought this set after comparing sets for hours at multiple stores, making multiple trips. I am still reluctant to buy a set unseen based on the observations of others, and reading reviews. I read countless reviews, and Samsung was at, or near the top. Reviewers gushed over the pictures and "soap opera effect".I initially bought a Samsung Smart HDTV, but after two weeks of trying to get it calibrated to my liking, I gave up, and bought the LG 47LS4600 "dumb" HDTV. The LG does great with skin tones, and whites. The Samsung washed out whites, and had poor skin tones no matter what setting I used. While I enjoyed the soap opera effect, it wasn't enough to win me over. Color balance is more important to me.If you do buy this set, update the firmware. My set was less than 4 months old from the production date, yet there was a newer update available.Do a search for "47LS4600 support" or go to LG dot com, and enter the model number. There are pdf instructions and an update file in the support area. You will need a usb stick.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture not so good Sound
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv through Amazon and shipping was great the tv arrived without a scratch. please note that although this tv does have an ethernet option is not a smart tv, meaning that it will not access the internet or use apps on its own. You will need a smart tv upgrader or a smart blueray player to do so.In my opinion this is the best option because by using smart tvs we are asking them to be similar to smart phones. How fast are smartphones outsmarted, maybe 3-4 years? so why attach a 3-4 lifespan  to a 10 year product?I am very impressed with this tv so far the picture is amazing. I was unsure of plasma or led and I am very pleased with the clear bright picture of this LED, Content from my pc streams very clearly to the tv through a wired connection. Video that is less than 1080 will stretch to the size of the screen and LG has added a feature that fills the empty pixels so even lower quality video still looks great.My only complaint would be the sound which is absoulity horrible but who buys a tv for sound? Hopefully my Yamaha YHT-397 (Home Theater in a box) will be here soon and take care of this problem.

Reviews.Title: CHOPPY - Truemotion NOT on this model as advertised
Reviews.Author: Power User
Reviews.Content: After hours on the phone with LG cusotmer support they finally acknowledged that this TV (47LS4600) does not have the truemotion feature as advertised. Fast moving pictures are horrible without it.  LG said truemotion will be coming out as a firmware upgrade but as I checked online many people seem to have been waiting for the upgrade for up to 6 months.  This product, or at least the description, should be pulled until they offer what they say they will.  Very disappointed to have wasted so many hours of precious time with my kids trying to get this to work.  Amazon, of course was perfectly responsive.  thank you for that.  Changed to a Sony and it has been perfect out of the box, although more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Best picture on the market, just wish the sound was better
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I'm a bit of a tv snob and am very picky about brand and picture quality of tvs.  It took me about 2 straight months of searching to settle on this tv.  I went to multiple best buys to compare samsung, lg, sony, panasonic, and sharp version of both plasma and LED tvs in person.  I quickly realized I needed LED for my situation since our family room has a lot of windows and gets a lot of sun during the day.  I will probably consider a plasma for a theater room I'm putting in my basement.  Anyways, after multiple trips to best buy it became apparent that the best led sets were samsung and lg and in my opinion lg was and is superior to samsung in terms of picture quality when it comes to LED.The amazon shipping service was a great experience as i think it paid $20 extra and scheduled an appointment when i ordered and the guy came and hand delivered it, took it out of the box, put it together on my tv stand in about 15 minutes.  The picture from the start was amazing.  I did some minor tweaking to brightness, etc. to cater to my preference, but I didn't have to change much .  I am not a gamer so I cannot speak to video game use, but i watch a lot of sports (10 hours worth of football every sunday) and movies and the picture has been great with both.  If i could, i would rate the picture 6 stars.Not everyone will think this matters since most people who have a tv this size have a theater system or at a minimum a sound bar (this is what i have), but sound does get tinny when the volume is at or above about 20 out of 100.  The only inconvenice to me is that i have to mute my tv whenever i turn it on and turn my soundbar on when I want good volume like for sports or movies.  This is the only thing that kept me from giving this tv a 5/5.Other than the sound, the picture is awesome, like i said, the tv itself is really good looking and has 3 hdmi inputs, which is good enough for most.  I would DEFINITELY recommend this tv and for those who are thinking about spending $100 less and getting a vizio, do yourself a favor and DON'T because vizios are crap.  In all seriousness, picture quality does matter when you compare a brand like vizio with LG.  in my opinion, LG has taken over samsung as the elite brand of big screen tvs.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Joseph
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to replace a 42" Panasonic that died in only 2 years. The picture quality is very good. So much brighter than my last TV. It's true that the colors seem to pop out. I was expecting bad sound because of some other reviews but was pleasantly surprised.A few things you may want to know:If you leave the energystar picture setting on "auto", which is the default, it will randomly dim and brighten the screen. It took me a little while to figure out what happened at first since I left the room, came back, and the screen looked a lot darker (and worse). I now have it set to minimum.The Intelligent Sensor works great. We tested this by opening the curtains all the way (sun faces our patio doors in living room) and the TV adjusted itself to be viewable. With the Panasonic any amount of glare ruined the screen. I also like the Vivid preset setting.It does have internet capabilities (wired only), but that is for firmware updates only, not apps or anything else.You don't need to drill a hole securing the TV to your stand. I got the 47" version and it is sturdy enough to be fine.Overall for $698 I think I made a good decision.. first LG TV and I may be buying more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture
Reviews.Author: Luci Blace
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an old DLP that was dying. I have a Samsung LCD that I like a lot, so I was a little anxious about getting this LG, but this TV is impressive - especially when you consider the price. The picture is just fantastic. Here's a breakdown of some of the awesome features of this TV:Pros:- Picture Wizard: Great built-in picture calibration tool.- Awesome picture quality- Save money with this model by not paying for all the built in extras (Amazon, streaming content, etc)- Simple menu interface- Works with my Harmony remoteCons:- Screen is glossier than other TV's I've had so glare is a little worse than my old TV- Had to dig into the options to disable the noise reduction processing that always seems to cause more issues than it solves- Weak built-in speakers. Will prob buy a soundbar to go with the TVThe TV has some minor issues, but it's a great price and it's got a beautiful picture. You can't beat the value for the price. We'll see how it holds up over time, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Good TV Lousy Sound
Reviews.Author: PK
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in August 2012 as a replacement for my Sony Vega 32. I did a lot of research before buying it and narrowed my search down to the LG, Samsung and Sharp. I usually always look for customer reviews because they are the truest yardstick for any product - especially objectively written 1 and 2 star reviews. One negative point that consistently emerged across different web sites was the 'tinny' sound. I often wondered what it meant. Anyway, after comparisons, I went for the LG because the price differential was significant between LG, Samsung and Sharp with the LG offering the best bang for the buck. I also reasoned that if the sound was too bad, I could go in for external speakers or a sound bar. In other words, I went into this with my eyes open. Well, here I am nearly 6 months later and here are my inputs.The picture is great - especially when watching newer digital movies or HD material. Its got 3 HDMI ports - In my initial review, I had erroneously put in 4 ports - thanks to Greg for pointing it out. Screen can be swiveled - very convenient. Overall, I am happy with the purchase based on picture quality alone and some of the available features.Sound is a different story altogether. Its not too good. The reviews were right - the speakers are "tinny". At slightly higher volumes, they start generating a vibrating noise and you cannot hear dialogues clearly. The sound is as if the speaker is kept on a vibrating tin object. Yuck ! For this factor alone, the market should be dumping this TV. LG really needs to get their act together and rectify the sound. What's the point in having a larger screen HD TV if the sound is a big let down ? I now am researching sound bars to ensure I get a good one for substituting the TV speakers.My recommendation would be to avoid this TV on its own unless LG rectifies the sound/speakers. If on the other hand, you already have a home theater or plan to pick up a good quality sound bar, then I would definitely recommend this TV. It would be good return on investment in that case. If the TV has an option to buy without speakers, that would be a great buy (Panasonic has that for some of its HDTVs). If however, you do not want to pick up a home theater or sound bar, I would suggest going in for a different TV - maybe a Sony or Samsung or even the Sharp 60 inch.I have given it 4 stars despite the sound because the picture quality is really good. If the sound was not a problem - even close to the Sony Wega (that has monster sound !), then this product would have got a 5 star from me.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV with No frills
Reviews.Author: Technocrat
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a non Smart LED TV with 120 Hz, I already have WDTV for all the smart features so didnt want those on my TV. And with this requirement I started looking for TVs & found this to matcth to the T. The sound system is decent it will sound bad only if the audio is with lot of Bass in most other uses it is decent. Overall Very Happy with this Purchase. Bought it from Sam's club as it was slightly cheaper there.

Reviews.Title: Needs firmware update for best picture
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 55" LED TV with 3D but did not want to pay $1,000 or more.  I have a Roku so SmartTV wasn't important to me.  When I found the 55LM4600 for $799 I went for it!  I calibrated the picture and found it still not as clear as my other LED TV so after trying to play with it for a few days I decided to look and see if it needed a firmware update.  It did, and after installing the update via USB my picture quality improved considerably.  I wish there was more 3D content to watch on it, but that's not LG's fault.I have a fair sized living room and there is probably close to 20' from the TV to my couch.  At half volume this TV is plenty loud enough to fill the room. I'm unsure why people are complaining about the sound unless something is wrong with the one they have.  The output for sound on the TV is optical only, but if you're like me and have a receiver you don't want to replace, I found a $25 optical to RCA adapter on Amazon that came with cable.  Many stores will tell you no such adapter exists snd you need to buy a soundbar or receiver - they are wrong.  There is, and it works just fine unless you are an audiophile.This is an excellent TV for what I spent, great value!  I would have given it 5 stars had I not needed to update the firmware manually.  I doubt many people have ethernet in the room their TV is in and the instructions on their website are not as detailed as they should be for USB.  If you are having customers update firmware of any kind, every single tiny step should be outlined.  Be aware that after downloading the firmware update, you need to unzip it into the folder on your flash drive.  Don't just copy it as the instructions state.  If I weren't in IT, I would likely still be trying to figure out why it wasn't working!

Reviews.Title: Nice looking TV, ok picture quality; rating based mainly on price paid
Reviews.Author: VM
Reviews.Content: This is a very good looking set; piano black w/ a pretty thin bezel. Looks good on my wall.I know that this is the entry-level set, so I'm not too upset by some of it's flaws. But there are some:-Compared to my LG Plasma (PM4700 series) and another Samsung LED (D8000 series), the color isn't as deep/vibrant.  They look a little pale. I've tried custom tuning as well as the picture wizard.-There's also more blur in fast-paced scenes. Also a little disappointed that you cannot customize TruMotion settings, or even turn it on/off.-I know not much should be expected of flat panel audio, but this one is the worst of my 5 sets. You have to turn it up quite a bit to hear voices and by then, any sudden audio spikes (like an explosion) will create a huge buzz/rattle in the speakers. In fact, I'm pretty sure one of them has already blown. But I have a HTIB hooked in, so audio is not an issue for me.-This is my biggest gripe. All rear input/output connections face straight out, instead of down. This made wallmounting w/ my very low-profile mount kind of difficult so I had to buy right-angle HDMI & TOSLink adapters. Regardless of where a model is in the price lineup, rear connections should always face downward since wallmounting is more the norm now.Despite these shortcomings; I got this TV for under $650, so it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Trainor
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV about a month ago and I am very happy. The set up was extremely easy and I had the TV going within 15 minutes. The TV is very thin and light and I plan eventually to mount the TV on the wall.  I really wanted the TV because of the USB port and I've been very happy with that feature.  I can play all of my media without having to stream or attach a computer.  Picture quality is excellent.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love it
Reviews.Author: Hxsolo
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV expecting quite a bit based on the reviews.  Unfortunately, it did not live up to the "buzz".  When mine arrived I noticed right away that there was a strange bulge in the bezel below the screen just to the right of center.  The bezel material is obviously very thin and this manufacturing defect makes the set look cheap.More importantly, the LED edgelighting bleeds through horribly.  Approximately 60% of the screen has significant clouding during dark images.  I have this set up in a dark room too and once you notice the clouding it attracts your attention even during regular scenes.  I have a ~10 year old Sony XBR2 LCD and I was expecting at least a slight improvement in picture given the time for advancement in technology but sadly my old set outperforms this one in every way.I am returning this set as of today.  Now looking at Panasonic plasmas instead.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Value - LG hits a homerun with this one!
Reviews.Author: B. Knerien
Reviews.Content: I've been searching for a 47" LED TV for a few months.  I kept going from Samsung to LG over the last month or so.  After reading reviews for this TV and comparing prices it was apparent that this TV was a good choice.  It weighs about 1/4 of the plasma I replaced and puts out nearly ZERO heat.  It was VERY easy to set up.  The picture is amazing and easily customizable.  The presets that LG offers are just fine for quick setup.  The sound is not as bad as I imagined though I would recommend a sound bar or total surround sound system to enhance the experience.The one thing that I was not happy about was the DLNA connectivity.  I read that this TV was DLNA certified and that was about 15% of the reason I bought it.  What was not conveyed through Amazon nor LG's web site was the fact that a true DLNA experience using the TV could only be achieved using Nero Media Home 4.  Although this software is provided free of charge it requires that I not use my current setup which is perfect using Mezzmo.  I was hoping the TV would be a stand alone DLNA client.  I've tried setting up the Nero Home Media software and it is very unstable.  It crashed several times during initial setup so I've just uninstalled it altogether.  I can circumvent this inconvenience by using my PC connected directly to the TV or by using my PS3 which is a very good DLNA client with Mezzmo.  Without using Nero Media Home 4 the only DLNA feature supported is picture viewing.The TV arrived with no substantial damage to the box and it arrived VERY quickly.  If you are a Prime member rest assured this TV ships immediately.I'll try to keep an eye out for comments or questions for this review as best I can.

Reviews.Title: Viewing at it's best
Reviews.Author: Barbara Meyer
Reviews.Content: We didn't need any crazy features, and this TV may have them, but it was the right price and looks great. All we do is watch TV. The picture is awesome. Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for us, great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Molly Nolan "Molly the Realtor"
Reviews.Content: I'm no "techy", just somebody looking for a bigger, nicer TV within our budget.  I stalked/compared prices in Target, Walmart- anywhere I went- for months so when I saw this offer I knew it was THE BEST price for this quality TV.  Like the other reviews said, the sound could be better, but you can't beat the picture quality while watching football! It's like you could pick the players off the screen! We had this shipped from Amazon, it arrived in timely fashion and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: dbjordan
Reviews.Content: The LG TV I purchased is exactly what I wanted, the TV arrived on time, well packaged and ready to set up.  The price was great.  The sound is good but probably not great although my hearing isn't the best, a sound bar took care of that.  The picture is very good.  I'm enjoying the TV very much and would highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Quick delivery
Reviews.Author: ken72653
Reviews.Content: Nice tv for the money. Not quite as "sharp" as my two Sharps but really do not have any complaints (I really believe it is due to signal strength of provider). Amazon got it to us quickly and in good shape. Packaging was nice.

Reviews.Title: Woo! This TV is sweet!
Reviews.Author: Hunter Wood Turner
Reviews.Content: This TV is incredible for the price that you pay. You can customize the image to WHATEVER you want, which is really neat! The picture is very clear and beautiful, I'm watching Book of Eli on it right now, haha. This TV is well worth your money, so get it!

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: RCA476mp
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV because of the price,and glad I did, the picture is great,the sound isn't that bad but not that great nether ,gets loud but distortion is really annoying. Just right for a bed room TV, but if your going to put this TV in your living room I would suggest a sound bar or surround.It's defenitly wourt the money LG's are good TV's, I've had my 32" for a long time with no problems.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: dac
Reviews.Content: This set has a great picture! It was an east setup and is very light. The Sound is fantastic right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: entirely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: I returned my Panasonic 55-inch plasma that had rave reviews from professionals and users alike.  I could not get used to the dark picture and the grainy image (and yes the room was dark).  I spent hours trying to calibrate it correctly.  The final straw came when I was watching a basketball game and simply could not see it clearly.  On a 55-inch set 15 feet away!So I returned it to the local vendor.  I didn't want to pay $100 more for a Vizio with buit in wifi.  There are numerous possibilities for providing wifi capability such as Apple TV, Roku, etc. or even through a computer with an HDMI port.The LCD LG has built in 3D and included 4 glasses and was the same price as the Panasonic.  I am so glad that I bucked the expert and popular opinion and went with this TV instead.  Ah, a SHARP and BRIGHT image!  Perhaps the colors are not as "rich" as the plasma but wow, sports are amazing looking. Movies look fine too!.I saw a complaint in the 2-star review that the it is not "true motion" and that motion is blurry.  Well last night I was watching Juan Martin del Potro serve the tennis ball at 130 mph at Indian Wells and I have never seen a tennis ball so clearly on a set before.  I could see quite clearly whether the ball landed in or out or on the line.  It was awesome!By the way, the sound is just fine for my purposes as well. I will keep my eyes open for a sound bar but in the meantime it is perfectly adequate an just as good as the Panasonic.In the end, choosing a TV that you like is highly subjective.  Spend a long time in the store making sure you like the one you have chosen and make sure there is a good return policy.

Reviews.Title: new tv
Reviews.Author: Thomas Womack
Reviews.Content: good quality, nice picture, good delivery time,good sound,picture size is great. fits in the room fine, the controls are easy to use

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my TV
Reviews.Author: buntbean
Reviews.Content: This TV has met my expectations and is working great.  All I did was plug it in and hook it up to my blu ray.  I haven't had to adjust anything.Update: My son bought me a sound bar (brand: Boston) for Christmas and I have to say I'm very happy with this set up.  Still love the TV.

Reviews.Title: For 499.99 this can't be beat!!!
Reviews.Author: KSGrice
Reviews.Content: Just picked this up at Frys yesterday for 500 bucks. I haven't spent too long with it, but I would trust the USER reviews more than expert reviews. Which weren't so good. I can't be more happier. Sound isn't great, but I use surround anyways so not an issue. It's not a smart tv, but who needs that? With all the options out there, you probably already have what a smart tv offers, between Xbox, play station, blueray players, roku boxes...the list goes on. Why pay 2-4 hundred more just for a smart tv? Buy this! Especially if you can get one for 500 like I did!

Reviews.Title: Lovin' my new LG 55LS4600 TV
Reviews.Author: DGR8ONE
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, tons of input and output options compared to Samsung TVs, but similar to Sharp TVs, but Sharp TVs don't seem to be 120hz for the fact that you can see the football blur, I was indecisive on which TV to get, LG or Sharp, but when I noticed the football blur I decided to go with the LG, it haves the plexiglass protection also, which is great if you have kids that touch your screen, I have a huge bedroom and the 55" is perfect, people said the sound is not good, but I think the sound is excellent, but I still bought the LG nb2020a sound bar just to spoil myself, which can be linked to your TV, which means you can use the same remote for your TV, one less remote in your life is a plus, overall, you won't be disappointed, all the Samsung hype is just a hype, besides, LG won best in show for the CES 2012 over all the other brands out there, that is right, best in show, LG is the way to go, LG and Amazon.com is a dynamic duo

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture, debatable sound
Reviews.Author: Cody Murrell
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with the expectation that the sound was going to be sub-par. I had read the reviews on both sides of the scale, hearing that the sound was not fantastic and was bad in a large room. I entertain several guests, and I was hoping for better sound. It comes out tinny at big points in movies, and I regretfully say I will have to buy a sound bar for this.I owned an Olevia 32" before this, and I never had any problems with the sound. You would think an "upper end" company would work on their sound systems a little more diligently than an unheard-of-at-the-time company. I'm fortunate that I was able to get this TV at a significantly lower price than the price listed by the company, otherwise I would be very upset at the prospect of buying a sound bar.My friend bought the 42" model, and I have heard no problems with his sound output. Is it just my TV? Is it all the TVs of this particular model? Who knows?What I DO know, is that the picture is spectacular. I do a lot of gaming and a lot of Netflix watching, and the HD movies/TV programs on Netflix show up great on the screen. It looks astonishing, and my friend circle have all agreed it looks great. The LED lighting really shows up, and the picture settings for Game/Cinema/custom are really spectacular. My only concern is for the sound system within the TV. If it were better, I'd give this TV 5 stars and a full blown recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: Before I got this TV I had a 42" LG non LED which I loved. I decided to upgrade to LED and I am very satisfied with my decision. The picture quality is amazing, regardless of the lighting. The software for the TV is also very easy to use. This might not seem like a big deal but I was over at a friends trying to figure out his Sharp TV, and the software wasn't helpful at all. TV is also very slim which makes it look good if it isn't wall mounted.If you are looking for a cheap LED TV I would highly recommend you consider this one before looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Kentj
Reviews.Content: I believe the might be the best LED TV for it's on the market.  There are no bells and whistles but if you want a great picture this is it.

Reviews.Title: lg TV
Reviews.Author: rickcapraro
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected and more, great picture slim frame makes viewing easier. Easy to set up compatible with all my electronics. Thank you

Reviews.Title: LG 47" LED TV
Reviews.Author: coastergirl
Reviews.Content: Product is as described, works great with a beautiful picture. The price is what sold us on this particular model. Since we'd had an LG 42" with the same specs, it was a no-brainer for us. Out of the box the screen was flawless and required no adjustment. The year parts and labor warrenty was comforting considering how much these cost to get fixed.

Reviews.Title: Decent and cheap
Reviews.Author: J. Lofgren
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to watch sports and play video games. It works great for both. No complaints. It is not incredibly bright, even when you turn up the brightness.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W. Moffet
Reviews.Content: LG 47LS4600 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED LCD HDTVGood quality picture. Speakers are weakest part of this television. Overall, a good buy. Happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Wickline
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research both on-line and in stores, we settled on this LG TV. We wanted a LED flat screen, since reviews on the three basic flat screen styles, rated the LED to be the best. WE have been more than pleased.This TV is all that it is advertised to be. We bought a sound bar to go with it. However, the TV's speakers put out adequate sound. Good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: MANDIESUE
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen television and I have to say I'm sorry I waited so long to come into the age of modern technology. After A week of research I finally decided to purchase the LG 47 inch and it is the best purchase I've made in a long time. The picture quality is great, the tv is really thin and light weight.Thanks LG and Amazon for making my purchase so easy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Dr. T. "Dr. T."
Reviews.Content: We are extremely pleased with this TV- the picture quality and features are top-notch. The TV was shipped quickly, and when it arrived, the delivery guys opened it up, checked for damage (there was none), and set it up by attaching the stand. Excellent service--excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Susan Martisius
Reviews.Content: We really like our new LG 47" TV.  We have the same TV in another room so we knew what we were getting.  Before we bought our first TV we did a lot of research and a lot of looking. The picture is fantastic and all the functions are easy to use.  And the price was right.  This is a great TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: First flat screen tv
Reviews.Author: Brian S. Tobin
Reviews.Content: As noted in the title of my post, this is the first flat screen television that I have owned. I am not tech savvy although I can get by. I did aloth of research on different brands and narrowed it to LG and Samsung. Went with LG because of price. All that said, I love this television. As far as flat screen and LCD TV's go this is pretty basic but that is what I wanted. I watch tv on my tv, along with DVD movies. I don't need or want it for anything else. I ordered this from amazon on a Thursday and had it by Saturday, nice job amazon. packaged well, no complaints whatsoever. Out of the box and to set up and on in about 20 minutes. Stand was surprisingly heavy and stable, I had thought I might need to mount on the wall since I have 280 pounds of dogs running around in the house but I don't believe that will be necessary. Picture is incredibly sharp and any adjustments are very easy with the Picture Wizard feature. The Trumotion must be working because I have no complaints after watching a weekend of football and seeing no problems. I saw some complaints related to sound quality but I don't hear them, sound is fine for me. Television itself is very thin and sleek. Overall I am completely satisfied, admittedly it has been less than a week but if I encounter problems, I'll update this post!!

Reviews.Title: No regrets!
Reviews.Author: B. Talley
Reviews.Content: Ordering anything online should cause us to be extra cautious. Reading reviews is a standard procedure for me, and honestly I hesitated on this TV, (the LG 55" 1080p) because several people mentioned the sound quality was bad. I guess we are just not that sensitive to 'sound' quality because frankly, we don't seem to have any complaints about that at all.  Occasionally, there have been times that I sort of hear a slight, (very brief) echo to a spoken word but when I say 'occasionally', I mean that maybe I've heard it once in two months.  And I think the only reason it registered on my ears at all, is because of my concern after reading some other reviews.  We love the TV.  The picture, in our opinion, is perfect, and we have zero regrets about buying it.  (But now my husband wishes he'd even gotten the BIGGER one!)  Oh my!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: The image quality for this TV is excellent from all angles. The picture wizard II feature allows you to easily calibrate your screen to get the best picture possible. There are a lot of image adjustment options which allow you to really fine tune what you see on the screen. The menus are nicely designed. The quick menu is convenient. There are a few things I noticed which a person might want to know. This shouldn't be a problem for most people, but one of the two component video inputs doubles as the composite video input. So if you use the composite video input you only have one component video input. Another thing is, if you connect a laptop to the TV via HDMI, the only aspect ratios available are 16:9 and 4:3. You don't get any of the zoom ratios when the HDMI signal is coming from a computer. Other inputs, including other HDMI devices, do have all aspect ratios available. The third thing that surprised me is that the TV is not grounded (no grounding plug), which concerns me a little bit. Other than that, the TV and remote seem very well built. I was surprised to find out that the TV itself can do picture slide shows, and play videos and mp3s off of a flash drive you insert, or via a network connection to your computer. Overall I am very happy with this TV. It does everything I want, very well, and it can do a little more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Overall Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: This TV is great for the money. It supports DLNA. The picture is incredible and the TV is very thin.only cons are:1. There is no wireless adapter that is compatible with this TV. There is an ethernet port to plug into a router though. They say this thing is not internet capable. To me that means that you cant use applications on it but I guess that also means they dont have wireless capability either. Seems like you should still be able to connect to your home router wirelessly.2. The controller is not programmable with any device that does not have LG Simplink.3. Sound is terrible. Basically unbearable. I purchased Sony HTSS380 3D Home Theater System to make up for it.The wireless thing bugged me but I use my PS3 for DLNA anyway so no huge deal there. Controller thing is minor for me.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in overall picture
Reviews.Author: BFS Lover
Reviews.Content: I don't write many reviews, so I'd have to be pretty disappointed with this product to do it.  Overall the basic functions etc. of the television are fine, but compared to other televisions I have, which are much older, the picture on this one is very dark.  I've played with all the settings (Brightness, Contrast, all the pre-set settings) to no avail.  The picture is just dark and has no real robustness to it.It's my first and last LG.  Our garage/workout area will probably inherit it in the next few months.Bummed.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Lpsmith
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It arrived on time and in perfect shape. Very easy to set up. Has a great picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: 2563me
Reviews.Author: 2563me
Reviews.Content: there are only two things that really matter to me that is sound and picture. the picture is awesome. five-star review.  But the sound is average when I read the reviews for  the sound of reviews said that it was awesome and powerful but that is not true like I said the sound is just average but everything else about the television is awesome

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV to replace my $2000 Samsung I splurged on five years ago.  After the Samsung died on me I promised never to spend that much on a TV again.The LG on paper looked like it would go toe-to-toe with the Samsung and for the price it was tough to pass up, not to mention it's 6 inches larger.  The fit and finish is nice with a familer glossy black border and i also liked how it was less than half the thickness of my previous tv.  So far so good.The first thing i noticed after turning the TV on however is how dull the picture was.  The resolution was there, I could see depth and every pore on an actors face but it was missing something i was used to.  After tweaking the picture to the best of my ability I was able to make it better.  The next problem I came across is that sometimes the picture will get a bit pixleated. This became obvious to me when watching a pixar animated movie.  This problem rarely occurs and I don't notice it when watching live action shows or playing xbox.I would have reviewed this TV 3 stars if the price wasn't so great.  I do recommend picking this TV up just don't expect to be blown away, especially if you're used to other high-end screens.

Reviews.Title: Amazon, you rock!
Reviews.Author: rosietheriviter
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my son because I like my two LG tvs.  His television evidently was defective because it worked less than 2 weeks.  Amazon, you rock!  Amazon provided free next day pick-up and return shipping and replaced the television at no cost with a new one which arrived witin 4 days. It works great.  Easy to set up, crytal clear images, good sound.

Reviews.Title: Oh yeah
Reviews.Author: Zach Sehee
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great value, adequate sound if you live in apt. Looks fantastic with video games / blu ray. Would recommend highly

Reviews.Title: Overall great TV
Reviews.Author: Kyle James
Reviews.Content: The picture is great on this TV, and I watch a lot of HD and Blu-ray. The only reason it doesn't have 5 stars is because the sound coming from the TV isn't amazing. My speakers make a crackling noise as if they were blown out every time I put the volume above 16 (for gaming or epic movie watching). I tried to hook the TV to my external BOSE speakers, but you need a special connector and they are expensive to buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice design, DLNA support, not a smart TV
Reviews.Author: Dorothy
Reviews.Content: Nice display, rotates on base, sound is good quality.  Has DLNA ability, not a smart TV.  Has a lot of ports for attachment of other devices.  Remote is very nice but due to Comcast / Xfinity you cannot use it while watching TV. ( I prefer the LG remote).

Reviews.Title: One Year In - TV Works When It Wants
Reviews.Author: Jason Kasinger
Reviews.Content: One year in on this TV and the thing has a mind of its own.  Sometimes it goes to some garbled screen of colors on its own and the only way to get rid of it is to pull the plug on the tv.  The remote wont work nor the buttons on the tv itself.  Also the sound quality is ridiculously poor.  This was my second tv because the one before it sucked too.  I thought it was a defect in the tv.  Turns out its just a crappy design i guess.  Wont make a purchase like this on Amazon EVER again.  Wont buy an LG EVER again.  Save yourself the heartache.  Go to local store.  Talk to humans.  Dont buy LG.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: texas critter
Reviews.Content: Clear and sharp and very small bezel makes it look even bigger.  A board failed in it after I'd had it about nine months, LG set up an appointment with their contracted local service, they came out, took the TV off the mantle, opened it up, replaced the board, put it back up on the mantle - all done in 30 minutes, no charge to me!  Been perfect ever since (about three months ago).  I own two other LG TVs, never a problem with them, all three are great!

Reviews.Title: Good TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Jack E. Heald "JackAz"
Reviews.Content: We bought this because football was coming. I really like the size and features. The sound reproduction is not great, but I didn't expect great because it is a flat screen. No complaints. Does what it should, when it should, how it should.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price..
Reviews.Author: Gravy Playa
Reviews.Content: I bought to of these.. One for myself and one for my spouse. Thin and lightweight. only 4 stars because the audio is ok but isnt the best. I had to buy an external speaker system.

Reviews.Title: Picture not that great
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after reading great reviews.  I have had the TV for over 6 months now to assure appropriate time and familiarity with the settings to see if I could get it right before writing a review.  The TV is just OK.  I was between the LG and the similar Samsung.  I should have bought the Samsung.  The 120hz refresh rate is nowhere near fast enough.  Sporting events or anything in motion is blurry.  The picture is not that clear even in HD.  I'm not sure the picture quality is better than my 52inch 7 year old LCD sharp Aqueous.  Recently went to my friends house who purchased the exact same Samsung I was looking at.  The picture quality was amazing.  Don't kid yourself.  Buy the Samsung.  Wish I did.

Reviews.Title: outstannding
Reviews.Author: Heather C. Mueller
Reviews.Content: TV, 3D, the online merchant all great. we could not be happier.only complaint, tv speakers are a little weak, but w/entertainment system sounds great.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: billingb
Reviews.Content: If I had to do it over, I would buy another Samsung.  I have a 5 year old Samsung 1080p LCD that has better picture quality and I prefer it over this tv

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Moon
Reviews.Content: Love it. The color,sound, resolution! The function of Internet connection is useful for us. We order movies online directly and play it on the tv, so convenient!If the Internet applications .e.g. YouTube, could store where we left after we quit the program or switch off the tv! It would also be nice to have quick forward and backward function when using YouTube to watch movies.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LS4600
Reviews.Author: William Reyes
Reviews.Content: This LG TV is great for the price (I paid approx $900). But I guess you get what you pay for. One thing that bugs me is the viewing angle degrades as you view it at an angle. It does let you swivel the screen so as long as your watching the TV by yourself and straight on, it's not an issue.The TV settings let you get really detailed in refining your picture by providing options that in the past were only available to calibraters. I've had it lock up on my twice and had to actually physically unplug it from the electrical outlet in order to reset it as the remote and power button were useless when locked. Perhaps a firmware upgrade may fix this issue but I have not updated it since I do not have it connected to a lan so I really don't.Bottom line is you can get a great picture looking straight on. For the price I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, features and value!
Reviews.Author: funboater
Reviews.Content: Being a person who spends money sparingly and only every 15 years for new electronics, I chose to purchase a TV that was not Smart and without 3-D.  It arrived in excellent condition and was easy to set up. There may be others who need more features, if not, this is the TV you should consider.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, sound not so much
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great but the speakers are sub par. Also, one of the speakers on the tv was broken when I received it

Reviews.Title: 100% Satisfied with this 55 inch LG Flatscreen TV
Reviews.Author: kone "kone"
Reviews.Content: Light and exceptionally thin, this is the first LG LED TV I have owned.  I am absolutely stunned by the detailed image on this TV.  Viewing old movies, especially in Blu-Ray, is like watching them for the first time.  This TV is easy to set up, easy to program, and within minutes is operational.  There are several visual modes programmed in the set that one can customize for optimal viewing.  I use the sports and vivid settings for the vast majority of viewing.  The sound is not theater quality by anyone's standards, so I hooked up my stereo speakers and now have theater-quality sound.  (I had to purchase a separate optical audio cable to hook the sound into the stereo receiver).  Additional features include hook-ups for HDMI (2)devices, and a very handy and useful USB port where one can play music and watch picture shows.This is a great TV.  It is a treat to have it in the house.  No more squinting to see sports scores!  The 55 inch screen initially seemed huge, but after a month of watching shows, I would not want anything smaller.  Our great room houses this TV and it is perfect fit.kone

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Weems
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  Nice picture and quality.  Easy to use remote.  Its mounted on our wall and works great with the mount.  Great buy

Reviews.Title: Moving up from an old RCA console
Reviews.Author: Neal Forney
Reviews.Content: My review may not be as great as some others, but I feel enthusiastic about this television anyways. Prior to this, my wife and I were watching TV on my great grandfathers old RCA console television (circa 1980). The cable finally went out on it, and it was not worth repairing. So we got this TV, and it is astounding. It's very thin and looks very attractive on the wall. The bezel around the TV is also very thin. The picture quality is very good. HD looks really fantastic on this screen. The color is vibrant and appropriate. It's probably too bright for the basement we live in but you can turn it down easily. Picture set up was really easy.For the money this is the best tv to get, in my humble opinion.

Reviews.Title: electronics
Reviews.Author: jason filla
Reviews.Content: The tv is great shipment was on time and couldn't be more happy would recommend using this company again.  The picture is clear and crisp

Reviews.Title: Great Led tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Kyle Veatch
Reviews.Content: The tv is so thin! Great for mounting on the wall. The LG menus are nice and have lots of options for adjusting  the picture. As with an edge lit LCD, the edges are brighter for dark scenes, which may be distracting. Also, the viewing angle is quite good, but I wouldn't suggest having an windows in front of the screen. I paid $1,099 for this tv at the time and I am happy with it. It is priced at $900 which is great.

Reviews.Title: Really like this TV
Reviews.Author: Chucktowndcroz
Reviews.Content: I've been abundantly satisfied with this.  There is only one problem.  There are no AV jacks on this TV.  Also doesn't do Netflix and Fbook natively.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Clintdawg
Reviews.Content: When reading some of the reviews about this TV, the thought of buying left me with a little anxiety.  However, I am very happy with this purchase.  This TV has a great picture and I have been amazed by it over and over.  It isn't a smart TV, but that wasn't what I was looking for, since I can get most of those feature through game consoles that I already own.  For the price, this TV was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Clear picture, great price, and great delivery service
Reviews.Author: L. Hyde
Reviews.Content: This just came out of the box last night and it looks great. I bought the 55" and it is big enough and very thin. Great feature that i have noticed so far is that it auto dims the picuture and auto brightens the picture depending if there is lights on or off. I will leave another review after i have had time to really test it out. I bought this through Amazon and the guys that delivered it were on time and took care of the TV... Great service there...

Reviews.Title: LG 55 Inch
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: No frills LED TV.  Great picture and light as a feather.  Mounted it on the wall with little effort and it hooked up easy.  Doesn't have a lot of hookups in the back but worked for me and I have a 5.1 system.  Have had it installed for two months with no problems and it is on all day.

Reviews.Title: Great TV All Around
Reviews.Author: James Morse
Reviews.Content: This tv fit my needs perfectly. I was slightly concerned about ordering online and it being delivered, but it came intact without even a dent in the box. I have the tv angled near a window, and I do not get an obnoxious glare at all. The sound quality is great just from the tv or if you output it to a surround sound system. Great tv for a low cost.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: George "George"
Reviews.Content: We like this tv and the price was excellent.  Good picture and sound. I recommend this tv to all. Nice buy

Reviews.Title: lg tv
Reviews.Author: Doug Hansen
Reviews.Content: Better than my 47 inch Samsung that I gave 1600 hundred for.  Only downer is the speaker system, not a lot of volume but adequate

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: theharvey
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the money! The picture is crisp and bright. The motion is also impressive and I haven't noticed any refresh rate issues!

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: cambrieon
Reviews.Content: Really nice picture quality on HD for the cost.  You do have to adjust it in the menu settings, but great after.  Sounds good, wouldn't mind additional speakers to make it crisper and add surround sound experience.  Nice slim remote which matches the slim trendy look of the tv. Shipped fast and was easy to install within minutes.

Reviews.Title: LG 47LS4600 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Roman
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a few weeks now. Overall I am happy but there are a few things that bother me a little.1. The sound sometimes produces echo that is not pleasant to hear. I am still trying to determine if this is isolated to one specific channel.I don't hear it all the time though. I am planning to buy a sound bar so maybe it will fix the echo problem.2. The screen is somewhat darker than what I would like. I tried to adjust the picture but so far I was not able to get the picture that would make me 100% happy.3. The manual suggests to secure the TV to the stand with the screw to prevent tipping. First of all, people usually don't want to ruin the stand by driving a screw into it. So this suggestion does not make a lot of sense. Second, what about people (like myself) who have TV stands with the glass top? Are we supposed to drive a screw in the glass surface? There must be a different solution.

Reviews.Title: This is a 60hz LCD confirmed by LG and black levels not the best
Reviews.Author: amazonionial
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV on a deal that made it about 1/2 of MSRP and for that price I will keep it.  The set is really a 60hz panel that flashes LEDs for a truemotion effect, one that has been debunked as delivering the real effect of 120hz.  Blacks are not very deep and it suffers from a lot of edge light.  The color is really great, The glare is not too bad on the shiny screen, 3D is a cool novelty, gaming seems OK.  The fit and finish are very nice and it looks real good.  If you are paying 3/4 of MSRP or more look at another option like TCL or a manufacture that doesn't embellish the numbers.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LS4600 needs calibration
Reviews.Author: SpecTP
Reviews.Content: LG LCD tend to be over bright backlighting so make sure you get it calibrated.  You can start with backlight at 30, Contrast at 90, brightness at 70.  I still think the glare off the screen is annoying.

Reviews.Title: LG 47LS4600
Reviews.Author: S. Bank "Aqua"
Reviews.Content: Not sure if there is a certain number of these TV's that are defective or I'm expecting to much. However this tv picture quality is horrible. I tried everything. I sent it back and selected a Samsung UN46ES6003 for about $100 more. I suggest anyone making this important purchase to do just so. Because there is no comparison. A tv is something you will have for along time and $100 is nothing in my opinion. This Samsung is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great TV/Great Service
Reviews.Author: FootballFan05
Reviews.Content: I don't typically write reviews for online purchases but the quality of this TV and the quality service I received from Amazon made me have to write this review.  The TV is amazing.  It has a great picture and is incredibly thin.  For the size of the TV it's also not heavy at all.  I upgraded from a 32" LCD to this 47" LED and the different is remarkably.As for the customer service, I used the saver shipping method and it was supposed to take 5-8 days.  I got it within 3days.  This is why Amazon is as great as they are.  It's so refreshing in this day and age when everything seems to be delivered slow and the customer doesn't matter that Amazon goes above and beyond.  I will continue to constantly order things from amazon due to this.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment With Sound and Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Jekahog "JK"
Reviews.Content: I'll be quick and straight forward about this TV. The sound quality SUCKS greatly. I had a Mac Mini plugged to it and a PlayStation. Whenever I'm playing music, there was no way to tweak the sound as to be pleasurable. IT WAS JUST HURTING MY EARS! They also claimed that it is 120Hz. Don't see it. Looks the same as a 60Hz TV. I decided to return it for a the Samsung UN46EH6000 with 240 CMR Picture. I WAS BLOWN AWAY BY THE SOUND AND IMAGE QUALITY.. (Good bass and all) also the USB input surprisingly supports MKV Videos!! Just plugged in my WD Element HDD 1.5TB and before you know it i was enjoying Anime encoded MKV!This LG only supports a very limited amount of formats to my knowledge.GLAD I SWITCHED IT BEFORE IT WAS TOO LATE!PLEASE THINK TWICE ABOUT THOSE FEATURES BEFORE PURCHASING THIS LG TV!

Reviews.Title: Couple of really stupid features
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey evans
Reviews.Content: The light sensing system over reacts to ambient light so in a dark room the picture goes too dark whereas in a light room it's fine.Main Beef is the position of the connections for internet and HDMI--Right at the centre of the backWhich means for wall mount they are totally inaccessible and the HDMI connections go straight out which means you can't adjust the angle.Poorly thought out design,and I ran a design Engineering business!

Reviews.Title: If you watch any standard definition programming....
Reviews.Author: Picture Perfect ?
Reviews.Content: I bought the LG 47inch LED to replace my 32 inch Samsung.I use the LG to watch both HD and standard definition programming on cable tv. The picture quality on HD programs is excellent,however,the picture quality on standard definition programs is not at all good. By comparison with the Samsung which had an excellent quality picture on both HD and standard definition the performance of the LG is certainly disapointing. Since the cable company I have does not provide all channels in HD it is absolutely noticeable when you are watching a standard definition program. If you intend to use the LG 47 inch for gaming,Blue Ray,and strictly HD programming I guess you shouldn't have any problems, but be advised the quality of picture in standard def. in my opinion is not good. The reason I could give it only 3 stars

Reviews.Title: Can't say thank you enough
Reviews.Author: Pamela Kelk
Reviews.Content: This same TV had been stolen from my house.  When I got the insurance check I was so excited I ordered a new one right away...forgetting I was going out of town.  I immediately contacted One Stop Shop.  They responded very quickly to my email and held my package so it would be delivered after I got back.  I can't thank them enough!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: The TV is absolutely amazing. The only dislike is the audio. But, that's what surround sound is for. The picture is great, the size is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Crystal Clear TV
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Cummins
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV for my birthday and was super excited that it was such a nice clear picture. This LED TV is one of the best out there if not the best. It is super thin and surpasses all of my expectations. Best TV I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: LG LED 47' HDTV
Reviews.Author: Brandon Frangione
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is quite crisp and clean but i honestly cant tell the difference (other than it's slimness) between this tv and my LG LCD HDTV. To be quite honest, i actually prefer my older one better because this TV's sound is just plain awful. I'd recommend getting a soundbar so you wont have to listen to this TVs horrible speakers.

Reviews.Title: good picture good value
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: great TV but immediately dated with no smart TV functions so won't work with amazon prime instant video for example.  picture quality, ease of use, thinness are all awesome though. quality product

Reviews.Title: Pretty good TV
Reviews.Author: jameson stewart
Reviews.Content: Amazon had this product at my doorstep in TWO DAYS!!!!  I was very happy about that.  And the quality of the tv for the price is unmatched.  Picture was excellent, although I struggle to get it "just right."  It's my goldilocks issue but I'm rather demanding when it comes to quality.  For the price I paid, which was REALLY cheap for some reason, it was a wonderful deal.

Reviews.Title: Good Value TV
Reviews.Author: Peter Watts
Reviews.Content: I held out for a long time before buying a flat screen TV because I am cheap and I still wanted one that is high quality and I wanted a fairly big one.  If you are like that, than this is a good TV for you.  Very good picture quality, its stable on the dresser I put it on, easy to use, and I paid less than $700 for it before Tax.  At 47", with LED, and 120 hz that is a good deal.  It also arrived very well packaged, both in the Amazon box and the LG box.My one minor complaint is that it only takes one "component" at a time, so you can't put a bunch of older electronic compenents like VCRs into it at the same time even though you can plug a bunch of other stuff.  I tried using both an older Roku player and a PS2 that I use as my DVD player into it at the same time, but the plug set on the bottom requires the more recent three plug version to show the picture in color.  Its not a big deal to me since I also ordered a wireless blueray player which will do the work of both of those, but its something to note.There are probably a lot of better TVs out there, but good luck finding a better one this size in this price range.

Reviews.Title: speakers
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: great picture easy to set up, looks great on the wall. Two weeks after I bought it the speakers started to vibrate. I changed bass setting to 30 and turned clear voice on to 3, so far no vibration.

Reviews.Title: Such a bummer
Reviews.Author: golnaz
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about the purchase, but the tv is awful!!  I just bought it in October and a couple months later the speakers gave out.  I have to have it on a very low volume if I don't want to hear muffling in the background.  Really upset and wish I had bought a Samsung instead!  Don't invest buy in this tv!!!!  Evey once in a while the screen flickers too!!! Worst amazon purchase ever!

Reviews.Title: TV has little documentation...
Reviews.Author: A. russo
Reviews.Content: The owners manual is very sparse.  Features such as Tru-Motion are not described at all.  That detracted significantly from my satisfaction.  Customer Service is difficult to deal with as they are in a foreign country, and difficult to understand completely.

Reviews.Title: LG 55LS4600 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED LCD HDTVby LGLG 55LS4600 55-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED LCD HDTV by LG
Reviews.Author: RON
Reviews.Content: PICTURE QUALITY INITIALLY NEEDS SIGNIFICANT ADJUSTMENTS , BUT AFTER WORKING WITH THE MANY AVAILABLE ADJUSTMENTS IS A GOOD PICTURE NOW.  MAJOR PROBLEM IS THAT THE SPEAKERS RATTLE AND ARE EVEN BAD AT LOW VOLUMES.  OF COURSE GETS WORSE AT LOUDER VOLUMES.  THIS IS "AS IS" OUT OF THE BOX AND THE SPEAKERS HAVE NEVER BEEN PLAYED AT ANY HIGH VOLUMES AT ANY PERIOD OF TIME..

Reviews.Title: NO WALL MOUNTS
Reviews.Author: Robin J. Choi
Reviews.Content: This TV has to use its own type of bracket to mount on the wall.  There is no way to mount this to a universal wall mount.The only issue is, the 2 models of brackets for this tv do not exist anywhere.  I couldn't find a single place that sells them.  I called LG, and even the vendors they referred me to say that they do not sell wall mounts or brackets.I'm returning this to Amazon and will never deal with this company again.  I expected more from LG.  They do not even offer their clients product support.

Reviews.Title: I AM HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THE SOUND
Reviews.Author: ROCIO
Reviews.Content: I AM HAVING PROBLEMS WITH MY TV, I BOUGHT IT A MONTH AND A HALF AGO. THE SOUND IS NOT WORKING WELL... AT ALL.I AM VERY UNHAPPY AND DISAPPOINTED WITH THE PURCHASE ...I DON'T KNOW WHAT I SHOULD DO NOW...I SPENT ALL MY SAVINGS IN THIS TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic television, Amazon and their shipper were a disappointment
Reviews.Author: godvilla
Reviews.Content: The television is stunning.  Amazing image, small bezel, low power consumption, just a bit thicker than an inch, and doesn't have all of the frills modern sets like to push at people.  Until "3D" becomes something more than a simple manipulation of the eyes through some silly glasses with a limited amount of quality material to view, I have no interest in paying for it.  Also "smart televisions" seem redundant when every other device on my system (xbox 360 and blu-ray player) have access to the applications I enjoy.  This is the perfect television for me at a reasonable price.That said, I removed two stars because of my distaste for Amazon and the shipper they used (CEVA).  Amazon has expanded with 17 new warehouses in an attempt to speed the shipping process, but at the same time added sales tax for the states it moved into.  That's all fine and dandy, but this new-and-improved shipping standard took almost two weeks to arrive.  Out of that time, based on tracking the package, the television sat in Austin (where I'm located) for an entire week at CEVA's warehouse.  They called me once to tell me they could deliver in the middle of the workday, and otherwise I'd have to pick it up from them.  I use public transit, and the whole reason I shopped Amazon (now without the benefit of being cheaper) was to have the item delivered!  It took about 3-4 angry calls to the CEVA manager here in town until they finally decided to act like delivering packages is the whole point of their business.So basically my point in a nutshell:  this is a top-flight television that you should buy in-person through a different retailer.

Reviews.Title: Lg 47ls600 true review
Reviews.Author: Craig Foxxx
Reviews.Content: Hello so I ordered this Tv a couple of days ago. but before buying this tv i searched all over for real reviews and videos by real people and never seemed to find one i thought was actually by a real non paid person..so far wat i read i like but i will have to find out myself..  since my lg tv 47ls4600 will be here tomorrow sat. 15.2012 i will be reviewing this product with my opinions and this is my first time buying a flat screen tv.. i just got my own apartment.. yes!! but if there is anything you guys want to know in particular let me know and i will review it.. im thinking about doing a video review

Reviews.Title: LG 55LM4600 Bad straight from store
Reviews.Author: egdeleon
Reviews.Content: I purchased LG 55LM4600 unit at Walmart .  Bad straight from store.  The 3D was actually very good at first but noticed haziness in the background so that wasn't crisp.  Since this was attached to a 5.1 3D stereo system I didn't think of using the unit's speakers.  A day leater it dawned on me to do so.... Boy were the speakers real bad on the unit I had... I don't think this was the case from other reviews... must be a bum unit.Also had a problem with cable system not pushing enough HD but the TV this replace (A 47") did not have problems showing HD.Anyway LG 55LM4600  seems to have given me a bum unit ...returned it to local walmart...

Reviews.Title: 47" LG TV
Reviews.Author: edg
Reviews.Content: Not sure what to say at this point because this was purchased as a Christmas present and obviously it has not been given , opened, or used.
